SENT.plain: A four cases of sigmoid sinus thrombosis due to chronic exacerbated otitis media were presented
In all patients surgical intervention involved a radical mastoidectomy and exposure of the sinus
In two cases sigmoid sinus was incised and the internal jugular vein ligated
In the two others, sinus was only needled
A high dosages of antibiotics were administered parenterally
All patients were discharged in good state of heals
